Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw basic shapes to represent plants.
The student shows some understanding that color can be used but might inconsistently apply it (e.g., uses green for both healthy and unhealthy plants without considering differences).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately show the difference between a plant getting water and a plant without water (e.g., both plants may appear the same).
The student may not depict any signs of a plant lacking water, such as droopy or wilted leaves (student does not grasp the effect of water on plant health).
The student does not represent the concept that water is essential for plant health (may think plants always look the same regardless of water).
The student may not use colors and shapes to accurately depict patterns of health in subtle ways (e.g., brown leaves for a lack of water).
